question: Who was the first Prime Minister of India?
solution: Jawaharlal Nehru was the first Prime Minister of India.

question: In which year did India gain independence?
Which movement was led by Gandhi in 1930?
solution: Gandhi led the Dandi March in 1930 as part of the Civil Disobedience Movement.

question: Who is known as the 'Iron Man of India'?
solution: Sardar Patel is known as the 'Iron Man of India' for his role in uniting the country.

question: Which act was passed in 1919 to suppress political dissent?
solution: The Rowlatt Act of 1919 was passed to suppress political dissent.

question: What was the main objective of the Quit India Movement?
option4: Increase Indian representation in British Parliament
solution: The Quit India Movement aimed to end British rule in India.

question: Who was the leader of the Azad Hind Fauj?
solution: Subhash Chandra Bose led the Azad Hind Fauj (Indian National Army).

question: When did India become a Republic?
solution: India became a Republic on January 26

question: What was the significance of the Simon Commission?
option2: It was a British inquiry into the Jallianwala Bagh massacre
option3: It led to the formation of the Indian National Congress
option4: It was a commission to review the government of India
solution: The Simon Commission proposed constitutional reforms but was boycotted as it had no Indian members.

question: Who was the first Indian to win the Nobel Prize?
solution: Rabindranath Tagore was the first Indian to win the Nobel Prize in Literature.
